definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: I'll get old, but not lose first naive.
sentences.chinese: 我會越來越老成，卻不會丟掉最初的天真。

sentences.english: In general, teachers are always experienced and prudent. (
In other words, face reality and be adult in your responses to life's challenges.
sentences.chinese: 面對生活的挑戰，要老成持重，應付有方。

sentences.english: Exercise courtesy and tact at all times.
sentences.chinese: 總是練習着彬彬有禮且老成練達。

sentences.english: I had no idea that she was as old as that.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道她老成那個樣子。

sentences.english: From the back room he brought an immensely old young man.
sentences.chinese: 他從裏屋領出一個非常老成的年輕人。

sentences.english: But I was a mere lad of six-teen; I've aged a year since then.
sentences.chinese: 但我也只有十六歲，從此後我變得很老成。

sentences.english: He knows his way about and should be able to handle the case.
sentences.chinese: 他知道他老成練達，並應能處理有關案件。

sentences.english: She felt a little older than they.
sentences.chinese: 她覺得自己比他們老成一些。

sentences.english: She was perfectly disposed to make every allowance for the colonel's advanced state of life which humanity required.
sentences.chinese: 她完全可以理解上校的老成持重，這是人類所必需的。

definition: old and decrepit/proud of one's age and experience (idiom)
experienced in the ways of the world (idiom); worldly-wise/sophisticated
prudent/cautious/to be in charge of ritual ceremonies/to hold an important office
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
variant of 老奸巨猾[lao3 jian1 ju4 hua2]
